comments.comment_body: High confidence due to the typical presence of well-developed soil ecosystems, but allowing for slight uncertainty due to potential variations in specific forest types or environmental conditions.
High confidence due to the generally rich soil environments in these forests, but accounting for possible exceptions like flooded forests or unique soil conditions.
Moderate to high confidence due to the typical presence of soil environments, but acknowledging potential variations in soil characteristics or specific woodland types.
Moderate to high confidence due to the general association with soil environments, but allowing for potential exceptions or unique soil conditions in certain tropical woodland types.
Moderate confidence due to the presence of unique intertidal soil conditions, which may differ significantly from typical terrestrial soil environments.
Moderate confidence due to the wide range of environments encompassed, with varying degrees of soil interaction depending on specific land use practices and human modifications.
Moderate confidence as temperate biomes generally include forests, grasslands, and shrublands associated with soil, but acknowledging potential exceptions or subregions with minimal soil interaction.
Moderate confidence due to the frequent presence of soil environments in rainforests, savannas, and grasslands, but considering possible exceptions or subregions with limited soil interaction.

Moderate confidence as subtropical biomes encompass diverse environments like forests, grasslands, and deserts, many involving soil, but acknowledging potential exceptions or subregions with limited soil interaction.
Moderate confidence due to the presence of soil environments in various ecosystems at higher elevations, but considering potential limitations in rocky areas or regions with sparse vegetation.
Moderate confidence as soil environments exist in tundra regions within polar biomes, but acknowledging limitations due to areas with permanent ice or snow cover.
Moderate confidence due to the general presence of soil environments in boreal forests and taiga, but considering potential limitations in specific conditions or subregions.

Moderate confidence as subalpine biomes often include forests, meadows, and shrublands with soil environments, but acknowledging potential limitations in rocky areas or regions with sparse vegetation.
Moderate confidence as arid biomes typically have soil environments, but recognizing potential variations in soil types and conditions depending on the specific arid ecosystem and moisture levels.
Moderate confidence as village biomes involve soil interaction due to human settlements and agricultural activities, but acknowledging variability depending on land use practices and infrastructure.
Mangrove biomes exist in intertidal zones with unique soil conditions that are periodically submerged by water, which may not fully align with typical soil environments.
The compatibility with the Soil extension varies significantly within this category depending on the specific type of anthropogenic environment and the degree of soil interaction.
Encouraged finer grained scoring, more targets comments, inclusion of super classes even if they seem redundant
High confidence due to the inclusion of agricultural environments within this category, but allowing for some uncertainty as it also encompasses non-agricultural anthropogenic biomes.
High confidence as built environments fall under anthropogenic influences, but acknowledging the inclusion of non-built environments within this category.
High confidence due to the relevance of dense human settlements to built environments, but allowing for some uncertainty as not all dense settlements are extensively built-up.

Moderate confidence due to the potential presence of hydrocarbon resource extraction activities within anthropogenic terrestrial biomes, but acknowledging the broad scope of this category and the possibility of environments without hydrocarbon resources.

High confidence due to the frequent presence of hydrocarbon resource extraction activities within anthropogenic terrestrial biomes, but acknowledging the possibility of environments without hydrocarbon resources.
Moderate confidence as offshore oil and gas extraction occurs within marine environments, leading to the presence of fluid hydrocarbons in these areas.
Moderate confidence due to the possibility of hydrocarbon extraction activities occurring near freshwater bodies, leading to the presence of fluid hydrocarbons in certain freshwater environments.
Moderate confidence as oil and gas exploration and extraction occur in Arctic tundra regions, leading to the presence of fluid hydrocarbons in these areas.
Moderate confidence as many arid and desert regions are rich in hydrocarbon resources and extraction activities, leading to the presence of fluid hydrocarbons in these environments.
please include the "may be relevant" biomes, emphasizing where fluid hydrocarbons may be found, more so than biomes that might be affected by spills or runoff.

High confidence due to the association of hydrocarbon resource extraction activities, including core sampling, with anthropogenic terrestrial biomes, but acknowledging the possibility of environments without hydrocarbon resources.
Moderate confidence as offshore oil and gas exploration involves core sampling within marine environments.
Moderate confidence due to the presence of oil and gas exploration and core sampling activities in Arctic tundra regions.
Moderate confidence as many arid and desert regions contain hydrocarbon resources and undergo exploration involving core sampling.
High confidence as microbial mats and biofilms are frequently found in aquatic environments, but acknowledging the possibility of their occurrence in non-aquatic settings.
High confidence due to the prevalence of microbial mats and biofilms in marine ecosystems, but considering potential variations in their distribution and abundance.
Moderate confidence as microbial mats and biofilms can occur in various freshwater environments, but acknowledging potential variations in their prevalence and specific habitat preferences.

High confidence as this extension is designed for miscellaneous environments, which often fall under anthropogenic influences, but acknowledging the inclusion of natural environments within this category.
High confidence as this extension encompasses miscellaneous environments, including terrestrial ones, but considering the possibility of aquatic or other non-terrestrial environments.
Moderate confidence due to the possibility of miscellaneous environments occurring in aquatic settings, but acknowledging the broader scope of this extension beyond aquatic biomes.
High confidence as plant-associated environments are commonly found within forest biomes, but allowing for some uncertainty due to potential exceptions or variations in specific forest types.
High confidence due to the frequent presence of plant-associated environments in woodland biomes, but acknowledging potential variations in plant communities and soil conditions.
High confidence as shrubland biomes typically involve plant-associated environments, but allowing for some uncertainty due to potential variations in shrub types and densities.
High confidence as grassland biomes often include plant-associated environments, but acknowledging potential variations in grass types and the presence of other vegetation.
Moderate to high confidence as mangrove biomes are characterized by specific plant communities, but acknowledging the unique intertidal conditions and potential variations in mangrove species.
High confidence as sediments are typically associated with aquatic environments, but allowing for some uncertainty as not all aquatic biomes have significant sediment deposition.
High confidence due to the presence of sediments in various marine ecosystems, but acknowledging potential variations in sediment types and distribution across different marine zones.
Moderate to high confidence as sediments are found in many freshwater environments, but considering potential variations in sediment deposition and the influence of water flow and currents.
we should include particulate matter that is likely to appear in in a sample collected from air.

High confidence as bodily fluids are often the immediate medium surrounding samples from host-associated environments, but allowing for some uncertainty due to potential variations in sample types and collection methods.
This mapping/subsetting will requre more Uberon terms

what about some of the solid environmental material ENVO_01000814 subclasses? ... i want to err on the side of inclusiveness. please include those and any releavnt subclasses of waste material ENVO_00002264 ... i would prefer if you picked among the subclasses of waste material more individually
High confidence as hydrocarbon resource cores are typically composed of rock materials, but allowing for slight uncertainty as there might be cases with unconsolidated sediments or other materials.
please use much more specific subclasses of fluid environmental material ENVO_02000140

High confidence as plant matter is often the immediate medium surrounding samples in plant-associated environments, but allowing for slight uncertainty as other materials like soil or water might also be relevant depending on the specific context.

High confidence as soil is a primary medium in agricultural environments, but allowing for slight uncertainty due to potential variations in agricultural practices and the use of other media like hydroponics.
what about any of these or any of their subclasses? animal litter, manure, nesting material, agricultural waste material, animal waste material, agricultural environmental material
Hallucination. ENVO_00000013 is cave system
Hallucination. ENVO_00000014 is cave system. landmass is ENVO_01001782
Hallucination. ENVO_00000015 is ocean. island is ENVO_00000098
Hallucination. ENVO_00000016 is sea. mountain is ENVO_00000081
Hallucination. ENVO_00000017 is saline hydrographic feature. peninsula is ENVO_00000305
Hallucination. there is no ENVO_00000018 entity. isthmus is ENVO_00000174

only a subset of these have been manually reviewed. ENVO:01001886 landform is probably a good anchor. Also 'human construction', 'environmental zone', 'environmental system', 'geographic feature'. Possibly 'hydrographic feature', 'island', 'roadside'
Moderate confidence as islands can influence local water conditions and currents, but acknowledging that they are not directly part of the water body itself.
Moderate confidence as peninsulas can affect local water circulation and coastal processes, but recognizing that they are not directly within the water body.
